rescue.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to save someone or something from a situation of danger or harm
rescue.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Survivors of the crash were rescued by helicopter.
She died trying to rescue her children from the blaze.
rescue.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: rescue
to remove someone from a dangerous, difficult, or unpleasant situation
Firefighters worked for two hours to rescue people from the building.
Will you rescue me if I get stuck talking to Sam?
come to the rescue/somebody’s rescue
to come and rescue or help someone
It was an embarrassing moment, but fortunately Paul came to the rescue.
Several people saw I was in trouble, but no one came to my rescue.
to prevent someone from being killed, harmed, or losing something, or to make it possible for something to continue
Wearing a seat belt can help save your life.
They saved the hospital from closure.
If you break down in the desert, there is no one there to save you.
pick somebody up
to rescue someone from a dangerous place by taking them away in a boat or aircraft
A lifeboat picked them up two miles from the coast.
They spent the night near the top of the mountain, before being picked up by a helicopter.
bail somebody out
to rescue a person, company etc from a difficult situation, by providing them with the money they need
A number of state-owned enterprises have been bailed out by the central bank.
He owed thousands of pounds and his mother had to bail him out.
rescue.translation[1].definitions[0].def: when someone or something is rescued from danger
rescue.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Rescue workers arrived at the scene two hours later.
Storms delayed the rescue of the crash victims.
rescue.translation[1].note_box[0].sectio: A woman is in hospital following a dramatic rescue from her blazing flat.
The lifeboat crew has been honoured for a daring rescue on the Cleveland coast.
The stormy conditions made it impossible to mount a rescue.
One fire fighter was severely burned in the rescue attempt.
A major rescue operation was launched yesterday after two divers were reported missing.
Rescue workers are searching through the rubble for survivors.
He was still conscious when the rescue team arrived.
A rescue helicopter is on its way.
They drew up a rescue plan that involved restructuring the firm.
rescue.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to save a company, country, or economic system that is in danger of failing, for example because of financial problems
rescue.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: The fund is aimed at rescuing financially troubled companies.
efforts to rescue the economy by lowering interest rates
rescue.translation[3].definitions[0].def: an occasion when a company, country, or economic system is saved from failing
rescue.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: The company faces bankruptcy unless a rescue can be negotiated.
The International Monetary Fundcame to the rescue.
rescue.translation[3].definitions[1].def: an attempt, effort etc to save a company, country, or economic system from failing
rescue.translation[3].definitions[1].exa: It’s an ambitious rescue effort, and some marketing experts question whether the strategy will be effective.
